text:
Is there any reason why the "Blocks" doesn't display before I "touch" them?

1. Have a repeater group ("Blocks") and set up default values for them.
2. Drag the module into a DnD area and see that the blocks won't display before I e.g. fiddle with the arrangement
Other places the UI has no problem just instantly showing it, but some places this happens.

Bonus question: what triggers certain changes to module-fields to prompt the "Apply changes" instead of 'ui refreshing instantly upon save'?
<https://gyazo.com/0b4b5bf37d1946f36eedbce82cff970a>

The module default are probably setup incorrectly. I recommend using the CLI and editing the fields.json to update the reapeters default content

The "Apply changes" thing happens to modules with any JavaScript in them

I have the option to set default values on
1. the block fields themselves
2. the repeater group
Option 1 would just make it so all entries would have the same content, "Joe Doe".
Option 2 gives me the option to let the entries have different content.
Can you image having default values on both cause conflict?

*I only use the CLI / hs watch
Hmmm yeah that looks like it should work. Try setting the "occurrence" default top 2

That was it! :slightly_smiling_face:
I guess it defaults to 0 if not mentioned

Ideally it would be listed underneath this topic
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#repeater-options>

Albeit it does show examples of the use of it around the place on the same page
